name: Chicken and Broccoli Stir-Fry
description: A quick and healthy stir-fry combining lean chicken breast with nutrient-rich broccoli and a simple brown rice base.
instructions:
1. Slice chicken breast into thin strips.
2. Heat olive oil in a pan or wok.
3. Add chicken and cook until browned.
4. Add chopped broccoli and a splash of water, cooking until tender-crisp.
5. Serve the stir-fry over cooked brown rice.
6. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

name: Salmon and Sweet Potato Bake
description: A simple and delicious baked dish with a great balance of protein, healthy fats, and complex carbohydrates.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
2. Chop sweet potato into cubes and toss with a drizzle of olive oil.
3. Place sweet potato on a baking tray and roast for 15 minutes.
4. Place the salmon fillet on the same tray and return to the oven for another 10-15 minutes, or until cooked through.
5. Serve with a side of steamed spinach.

name: Hearty Lentil and Spinach Soup
description: A comforting and nourishing vegetarian soup, perfect for a light lunch or dinner, packed with fiber and protein.
instructions:
1. Rinse lentils thoroughly.
2. In a pot, combine lentils with water or vegetable broth and bring to a boil.
3. Reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes until lentils are tender.
4. Stir in fresh spinach and cook until wilted.
5. Season with salt, pepper, and herbs of your choice. Serve hot.

name: Quinoa Bowl with Chicken and Avocado
description: A versatile and nutrient-dense bowl that's perfect for meal prep. It features a complete protein from quinoa and healthy fats from avocado.
instructions:
1. Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
2. Grill or pan-fry chicken breast until cooked through, then slice into strips.
3. While the quinoa and chicken are cooking, slice the avocado.
4. In a bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, chicken strips, and sliced avocado.
5. Drizzle with olive oil and season to taste.

name: Protein-Packed Scrambled Eggs with Spinach
description: A classic breakfast or brunch dish, supercharged with fresh spinach and served with a side of almonds for a healthy fat boost.
instructions:
1. Whisk eggs in a bowl with a splash of milk or water.
2. Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat.
3. Add the whisked eggs and gently push them around with a spatula.
4. When the eggs are almost set, fold in the spinach and continue to cook until the spinach is wilted.
5. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately with a handful of almonds.
